2) year - 1 else year;\n   212→    const era: i32 = @divTrunc(if (y >= 0) y else y - 399, 400);\n   213→    const yoe: u32 = @intCast(y - era * 400);\n   214→    const m: u32 = month;\n   215→    const doy: u32 = (153 * (if (m > 2) m - 3 else m + 9) + 2) / 5 + day - 1;\n   216→    const doe: u32 = yoe * 365 + yoe / 4 - yoe / 100 + doy;\n   217→    return era * 146097 + @as(i32, @intCast(doe)) @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Priority = models.Priority;\nconst IssueType = models.IssueType;\nconst IssueStore = storage.IssueStore;\nconst IdGenerator = id_gen.IdGenerator;\n\npub const CreateError = error{\n    EmptyTitle,\n    TitleTooLong,\n    InvalidPriority,\n    InvalidIssueType,\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const CreateResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    id: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    title: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Run the create command.\npub fn run(\n    create_args: args.CreateArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Validate title\n    if (create_args.title.len == 0) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(CreateResult, &output, structured_output, \"title cannot be empty\");\n        return CreateError.EmptyTitle;\n    }\n    if (create_args.title.len > 500) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(CreateResult, &output, structured_output, \"title exceeds 500 character limit\");\n        return CreateError.TitleTooLong;\n    }\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(CreateResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return CreateError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(CreateResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return CreateError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Load existing issues\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(CreateResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load issues\");\n            return CreateError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    // Parse optional fields\n    const priority = if (create_args.priority) |p|\n        Priority.fromString(p) catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(CreateResult, &output, structured_output, \"invalid priority value\");\n            return CreateError.InvalidPriority;\n        }\n    else\n        Priority.MEDIUM;\n\n    const issue_type = if (create_args.issue_type) |t|\n        IssueType.fromString(t)\n    else\n        .task;\n\n    // Parse due date if provided\n    const due_at: ?i64 = if (create_args.due) |due_str|\n        parseDateString(due_str)\n    else\n        null;\n\n    // Get actor (from flag, env, or default)\n    const actor = global.actor orelse getDefaultActor();\n\n    // Get config prefix (read from config.yaml or use default)\n    const prefix = try getConfigPrefix(allocator, beads_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(prefix);\n\n    // Generate ID\n    var generator = IdGenerator.init(prefix);\n    const issue_count = store.countTotal();\n    const issue_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n    defer allocator.free(issue_id);\n\n    // Create issue\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    var issue = Issue.init(issue_id, create_args.title, now);\n    issue.description = create_args.description;\n    issue.priority = priority;\n    issue.issue_type = issue_type;\n    issue.assignee = create_args.assignee;\n    issue.created_by = actor;\n    issue.due_at = .{ .value = due_at };\n    issue.estimated_minutes = create_args.estimate;\n\n    // Insert into store\n    store.insert(issue) catch {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(CreateResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to create issue\");\n        return CreateError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Add labels\n    for (create_args.labels) |label| {\n        store.addLabel(issue_id, label) catch {};\n    }\n\n    // Save to file (auto-flush)\n    if (!global.no_auto_flush) {\n        store.saveToFile() catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(CreateResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to save issues\");\n            return CreateError.StorageError;\n        };\n    }\n\n    // Output result\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try output.printJson(CreateResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .id = issue_id,\n            .title = create_args.title,\n        });\n    } else if (global.quiet) {\n        try output.raw(issue_id);\n        try output.raw(\"\\n\");\n    } else {\n        try output.success(\"Created issue {s}\", .{issue_id});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Run the quick capture command (create + print ID only).\npub fn runQuick(\n    quick_args: args.QuickArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    // Convert QuickArgs to CreateArgs\n    const create_args = args.CreateArgs{\n        .title = quick_args.title,\n        .priority = quick_args.priority,\n    };\n\n    // Force quiet mode for q command unless structured output is specified\n    var modified_global = global;\n    if (!global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n ts;\n    }\n\n    // Try YYYY-MM-DD format\n    if (date_str.len == 10 and date_str[4] == '-' and date_str[7] == '-') {\n        const year = std.fmt.parseInt(i32, date_str[0..4], 10) catch return null;\n        const month = std.fmt.parseInt(u4, date_str[5..7], 10) catch return null;\n        const day = std.fmt.parseInt(u5, date_str[8..10], 10) catch return null;\n\n        if (month < 1 or     // Convert to seconds (midnight UTC)\n        return @as(i64, epoch_day) * 86400;\n    }\n\n    return null;\n}\n\n/// Calculate epoch day from year/month/day.\nfn epochDayFromYMD(year: i32, 400);\n    const yoe: u32 = @intCast(y - era * 400);\n    const m: u32 = month;\n    const doy: u32 = (153 * (if (m > 2) m - 3 else m + 9) + 2) / 5 + day - 1;\n    const doe: u32 = yoe * 365 + yoe / 4      return try allocator.dupe(u8, \"bd\");\n    };\n    defer allocator.free(content);\n\n    // Simple YAML parsing for prefix: \"value\"\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \"prefix:\")) Provides workspace loading, error handling, and shared result types\n//! to reduce duplication across command implementations.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst output_mod = @import(\"../output/mod.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\n\npub const Output = output_mod.Output;\npub const OutputOptions = output_mod.OutputOptions;\npub const IssueStore = storage.IssueStore;\npub const DependencyGraph = storage.DependencyGraph;\npub const EventStore = storage.EventStore;\npub const StoreLoadResult = storage.StoreLoadResult;\n\n/// Common errors shared across CLI commands.\npub const CommandError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\n/// Context for executing a CLI command with an initialized workspace.\npub const CommandContext = struct {\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    output: Output,\n    store: IssueStore,\n    event_store: EventStore,\n    issues_path: []const u8,\n    events_path: []const u8,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    /// Number of corrupt entries skipped during load.\n    corruption_count: usize = 0,\n    /// Line numbers of corrupt JSONL entries (owned memory).\n    corrupt_lines: []const usize = &.{},\n\n    /// Initialize a command context by loading the workspace.\n    /// Returns null and outputs an error if workspace is not initialized.\n    /// Uses graceful corruption recovery: logs and skips corrupt entries.\n    pub fn init(\n        allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n        global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    ) CommandError!?CommandContext {\n        var output = Output.init(allocator, .{\n            .json = global.json,\n            .toon = global.toon,\n            .quiet = global.quiet,\n            .silent = global.silent,\n            .no_color = global.no_color,\n        });\n\n        const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n        const issues_path = std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" }) catch {\n            return CommandError.OutOfMemory;\n        };\n        const events_path = std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"events.jsonl\" }) catch {\n            allocator.free(issues_path);\n            return CommandError.OutOfMemory;\n        };\n\n        std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n            if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n                outputErrorGeneric(&output, global.isStructuredOutput(), \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\") catch {};\n                allocator.free(issues_path);\n                allocator.free(events_path);\n                return null;\n            }\n            outputErrorGeneric(&output, global.isStructuredOutput(), \"cannot access workspace\") catch {};\n            allocator.free(issues_path);\n            allocator.free(events_path);\n            return CommandError.StorageError;\n        };\n\n        var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n        var corruption_count: usize = 0;\n        var corrupt_lines: []const usize = &.{};\n\n        // Use recovery mode: log and skip corrupt entries instead of failing\n        const load_result = store.loadFromFileWithRecovery() catch |err| {\n            if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n                outputErrorGeneric(&output, global.isStructuredOutput(), \"failed to load issues\") catch {};\n                store.deinit();\n                allocator.free(issues_path);\n                allocator.free(events_path);\n                return CommandError.StorageError;\n            }\n            // File not found is OK - empty workspace\n            return CommandContext{\n                .allocator = allocator,\n                .output = output,\n                .store = store,\n                .event_store = EventStore.init(allocator, events_path),\n                .issues_path = issues_path,\n                .events_path = events_path,\n                .global = global,\n                .corruption_count = 0,\n                .corrupt_lines = &.{},\n            };\n        };\n\n        corruption_count = load_result.jsonl_corruption_count;\n        corrupt_lines = load_result.jsonl_corrupt_lines;\n\n        // Warn user about corruption (unless quiet/silent mode)\n        if (corruption_count > 0 and !global.quiet and !global.silent and !global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n            output.print(\"warning: {d} corrupt entries skipped during load\\n\", .{corruption_count}) catch {};\n            output.print(\"         Run 'bz doctor' for details, 'bz compact' to rebuild.\\n\", .{}) catch {};\n        }\n\n        // Initialize event store and load next ID\n        var event_store = EventStore.init(allocator, events_path);\n        event_store.loadNextId() catch {}; // OK if events file doesn't exist\n\n        return CommandContext{\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .output = output,\n            .store = store,\n            .event_store = event_store,\n            .issues_path = issues_path,\n            .events_path = events_path,\n            .global = global,\n            .corruption_count = corruption_count,\n            .corrupt_lines = corrupt_lines,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Clean up resources.\n    pub fn deinit(self: *CommandContext) void {\n        self.store.deinit();\n        self.allocator.free(self.issues_path);\n        self.allocator.free(self.events_path);\n        if (self.corrupt_lines.len > 0) {\n            self.allocator.free(self.corrupt_lines);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Check if corruption was detected during load.\n    pub fn hasCorruption(self: *const CommandContext) bool {\n        return self.corruption_count > 0;\n    }\n\n    /// Save the store to file if auto-flush is enabled.\n    pub fn saveIfAutoFlush(self: *CommandContext) CommandError!void {\n        if (!self.global.no_auto_flush) {\n            self.store.saveToFile() catch {\n                outputErrorGeneric(&self.output, self.global.isStructuredOutput(), \"failed to save issues\") catch {};\n                return CommandError.StorageError;\n            };\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Create a dependency graph from the store.\n    pub fn createGraph(self: *CommandContext) DependencyGraph {\n        return DependencyGraph.init(&self.store, self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    /// Record an audit event. Silently ignores errors (audit is best-effort).\n    pub fn recordEvent(self: *CommandContext, event: @import(\"../models/event.zig\").Event) void {\n        _ = self.event_store.append(event) catch {};\n    }\n};\n\n/// Output a generic error message in the appropriate format.\npub fn outputErrorGeneric(output: *Output, json_mode: bool, message: []const u8) !void {\n    if (json_mode) {\n        try output.printJson(.{\n            .success = false,\n            .message = message,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.err(\"{s}\", .{message});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Output an error with a specific result type for JSON mode.\npub fn outputErrorTyped(\n    comptime T: type,\n    output: *Output,\n    json_mode: bool,\n    message: []const u8,\n) !void {\n    if (json_mode) {\n        const result = T{ .success = false, .message = message };\n        try output.printJson(result);\n    } else {\n        try output.err(\"{s}\", .{message});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Output a \"not found\" error for an issue.\npub fn outputNotFoundError(\n    comptime T: type,\n    output: *Output,\n    json_mode: bool,\n    id: []const u8,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator, \"issue not found: {s}\", .{id});\n    defer allocator.free(msg);\n    try outputErrorTyped(T, output, json_mode, msg);\n}\n\n/// Initialize just the output without loading workspace.\n/// Useful for commands that do their own workspace handling.\npub fn initOutput(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, global: args.GlobalOptions) Output {\n    return Output.init(allocator, .{\n        .json = global.json,\n        .toon = global.toon,\n        .quiet = global.quiet,\n        .silent = global.silent,\n        .no_color = global.no_color,\n    });\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"CommandContext returns null for uninitialized workspace\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = \"/nonexistent/path\" };\n\n    const ctx = try CommandContext.init(allocator, global);\n    try std.testing.expect(ctx == null);\n}\n","numLines":226,"startLine":1,"totalLines":226}}}

Provides constant-time concurrent writes by appending operations to a WAL file\n     4→//! rather than rewriting the entire main JSONL file. Operations are:\n     5→//! - Serialized via flock before append\n     6→//! - fsync'd before lock release for durability\n     7→//! - Replayed on read to reconstruct current state\n     8→//!\n     9→//! WAL entry format (binary framed):\n    10→//! Legacy format (plain JSON lines) is also supported for reading:\n    19→//! {\"op\":\"add\",\"ts\":1706540000,\"id\":\"bd-abc123\",\"data\":{...}}\n    20→//!\n    21→//! Generation numbers prevent read/compact races:\n    22→//! - Each compaction rotates to a new generation (beads.wal.N -> beads.wal.N+1)\n    23→//! - Readers check generation before/after read and retry if changed\n    24→//! - Old WAL files cleaned up after successful compaction\n    25→\n    26→const std = @import(\"std\");\n    27→const fs = std.fs;\n    28→const Issue = @import(\"generation.zig\").Generation;\n    32→const test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n    33→\n    34→/// Magic bytes to identify framed WAL entries: 0x000B3AD5 (\"BEADS\" in hex-ish)\n    35→pub const WAL_MAGIC: u32 = 0x000B3AD5;\n    36→\n    37→/// Size of the binary frame header (magic + crc + len)\n    38→pub const FRAME_HEADER_SIZE: usize = 12;\n    39→\n    40→pub const WalError = error{\n    41→    WalCorrupted,\n    42→    WriteError,\n    43→    LockFailed,\n    44→    InvalidOperation,\n    45→    ParseError,\n    46→    OutOfMemory,\n    47→    ReplayPartialFailure,\n    48→    ChecksumMismatch,\n    49→};\n    50→\n    51→/// Statistics from WAL replay operations.\n    52→pub const ReplayStats = struct {\n    53→    applied: usize = 0,\n    54→    skipped: usize = 0,\n    55→    failed: usize = 0,\n    56→    failure_ids: []const []const u8 = &.{},\n    57→\n    58→    pub fn deinit(self: *ReplayStats, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) void {\n    59→        for (self.failure_ids) |id| {\n    60→            allocator.free(id);\n    61→        }\n    62→        if (self.failure_ids.len > 0) {\n    63→            allocator.free(self.failure_ids);\n    64→        }\n    65→    }\n    66→\n    67→    pub fn hasFailures(self: ReplayStats) bool {\n    68→        return self.failed > 0;\n    69→    }\n    70→};\n    71→\n    72→/// WAL operation types.\n    73→pub const WalOp = enum {\n    74→    add,\n    75→    update,\n    76→    close,\n    77→    reopen,\n    78→    delete,\n    79→    set_blocked,\n    80→    unset_blocked,\n    81→\n    82→    pub fn toString(self: WalOp) []const u8 {\n    83→        return switch (self) {\n    84→            .add => \"add\",\n    85→            .update => \"update\",\n    86→            .close => \"close\",\n 91→        };\n    92→    }\n    93→\n    94→    pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) ?WalOp {\n    95→        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"add\")) return .add;\n    96→        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"update\")) return .update;\n    97→        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"close\")) return .close;\n    98→        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"reopen\")) return .reopen;\n    99→        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"delete\")) return .delete;\n   100→        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"set_blocked\")) return .set_blocked;\n   101→        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"unset_blocked\")) return .unset_blocked;\n   102→        return null;\n   103→    }\n   104→};\n   105→\n   106→/// A single WAL entry representing one operation.\n   107→pub const WalEntry = struct {\n   108→    op: WalOp,\n   109→    ts: i64, // jws.objectField(\"ts\");\n   124→        try jws.write(self.ts);\n   125→\n   126→        try jws.objectField(\"seq\");\n   127→        try jws.write(self.seq);\n   128→\n   129→        try []const u8,\n   149→    data: ?Issue,\n   150→\n   151→    pub fn deinit(self: *ParsedWalEntry, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) void {\n   152→        allocator.free(self.id);\n   153→        if number\n   169→    owns_wal_path: bool = true, // Whether we allocated wal_path\n   170→\n   171→    const Self = @This();\n   172→\n   173→    /// Initialize WAL with generation-aware path.\n   174→ Operations are:\n//! - Serialized via flock before append\n//! - fsync'd before lock release for durability\n//! - Replayed on read to reconstruct current state\n//!\n//! WAL entry format (binary framed):\n//!   [magic:u32][crc:u32][len:u32][json_payload][newline]\n//!\n//! - magic: 0xB3AD5 - enables quick validation of WAL integrity\n//! - crc: CRC32 checksum of the JSON payload (detects corruption)\n//! - len: length of JSON payload (enables skipping without parsing)\n//! - json_payload: the actual WAL entry as JSON\n//! - newline: \\n for human readability when inspecting\n//!\n//! Legacy format (plain JSON lines) is also supported for reading:\n//! {\"op\":\"add\",\"ts\":1706540000,\"id\":\"bd-abc123\",\"data\":{...}}\n//!\n//! Generation numbers prevent read/compact races:\n//! - Each compaction rotates to a new generation (beads.wal.N -> beads.wal.N+1)\n//! - Readers check generation before/after read and retry if changed\n//! - Old WAL files cleaned up after successful compaction\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst fs = std.fs;\nconst Issue = @import(\"../models/issue.zig\").Issue;\nconst BeadsLock = @import(\"lock.zig\").BeadsLock;\nconst IssueStore = @import(\"store.zig\").IssueStore;\nconst Generation = @import(\"generation.zig\").Generation;\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\n/// Magic bytes to identify framed WAL entries: 0x000B3AD5 (\"BEADS\" in hex-ish)\npub const WAL_MAGIC: u32 = 0x000B3AD5;\n\n/// Size of the binary frame header (magic + crc + len)\npub const FRAME_HEADER_SIZE: usize = 12;\n\npub const WalError = error{\n    WalCorrupted,\n    WriteError,\n    LockFailed,\n    InvalidOperation,\n    ParseError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n    ReplayPartialFailure,\n    ChecksumMismatch,\n};\n\n/// Statistics from WAL replay operations.\npub const ReplayStats = struct {\n    applied: usize = 0,\n    skipped: usize = 0,\n    failed: usize = 0,\n    failure_ids: []const []const u8 = &.{},\n\n    pub fn deinit(self: *ReplayStats, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) void {\n        for (self.failure_ids) |id| {\n            allocator.free(id);\n        }\n        if (self.failure_ids.len > 0) {\n            allocator.free(self.failure_ids);\n        }\n    }\n\n    pub fn hasFailures(self: ReplayStats) bool {\n        return self.failed > 0;\n    }\n};\n\n/// WAL operation types.\npub const WalOp = enum {\n    add,\n    update,\n    close,\n    reopen,\n    delete,\n    set_blocked,\n    unset_blocked,\n\n    pub fn toString(self: WalOp) []const u8 {\n        return switch (self) {\n            .add => \"add\",\n            .update => \"update\",\n            .close => \"close\",\n            .reopen => \"reopen\",\n            .delete => \"delete\",\n            .set_blocked => \"set_blocked\",\n            .unset_blocked => \"unset_blocked\",\n        };\n    }\n\n    pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) ?WalOp {\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"add\")) return .add;\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"update\")) return .update;\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"close\")) return .close;\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"reopen\")) return .reopen;\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"delete\")) return .delete;\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"set_blocked\")) return .set_blocked;\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"unset_blocked\")) return .unset_blocked;\n        return null;\n    }\n};\n\n/// A single WAL entry representing one operation.\npub const WalEntry = struct {\n    op: WalOp,\n    ts: i64, // Unix timestamp for ordering\n    seq: u64 = 0, // Monotonic sequence number for deterministic ordering within same timestamp\n    id: []const u8, // Issue ID\n    data: ?Issue, // Full issue for add/update, null for status-only ops\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Custom JSON serialization for WalEntry.\n    pub fn jsonStringify(self: Self, jws: anytype) !void {\n        try jws.beginObject();\n\n        try jws.objectField(\"op\");\n        try jws.write(self.op.toString());\n\n        try jws.objectField(\"ts\");\n        try jws.write(self.ts);\n\n        try jws.objectField(\"seq\");\n        try jws.write(self.seq);\n\n        try jws.objectField(\"id\");\n        try jws.write(self.id);\n\n        try jws.objectField(\"data\");\n        if (self.data) |issue| {\n            try jws.write(issue);\n        } else {\n            try jws.write(null);\n        }\n\n        try jws.endObject();\n    }\n};\n\n/// Parsed WAL entry for replay.\npub const ParsedWalEntry = struct {\n    op: WalOp,\n    ts: i64,\n    seq: u64 = 0, // Sequence number (0 for legacy entries)\n    id: []const u8,\n    data: ?Issue,\n\n    pub fn deinit(self: *ParsedWalEntry, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) void {\n        allocator.free(self.id);\n        if (self.data) |*issue| {\n            var i = issue.*;\n            i.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n    }\n};\n\n/// WAL file manager for reading and writing operations.\n/// Supports generation-based file rotation for read/compact race safety.\npub const Wal = struct {\n    beads_dir: []const u8,\n    wal_path: []const u8,\n    lock_path: []const u8,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    next_seq: u64 = 1, // Next sequence number to assign\n    generation: u64 = 1, // Current generation number\n    owns_wal_path: bool = true, // Whether we allocated wal_path\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Initialize WAL with generation-aware path.\n    /// Reads current generation from disk and uses appropriate WAL file.\n    pub fn init(beads_dir: []const u8, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !Self {\n        // Read current generation\n        var gen = Generation.init(beads_dir, allocator);\n        const current_gen = gen.read() catch 1;\n\n        // Build generation-aware WAL path\n        const wal_path = try gen.walPath(current_gen);\n        errdefer allocator.free(wal_path);\n\n        const lock_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"beads.lock\" });\n        errdefer allocator.free(lock_path);\n\n        const beads_dir_copy = try allocator.dupe(u8, beads_dir);\n\n        return Self{\n            .beads_dir = beads_dir_copy,\n            .wal_path = wal_path,\n            .lock_path = lock_path,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .next_seq = 1,\n            .generation = current_gen,\n            .owns_wal_path = true,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize WAL with a specific path (for testing or direct path usage).\n    /// Does not use generation-aware paths.\n    pub fn initWithPath(wal_path: []const u8, lock_path: []const u8, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return Self{\n            .beads_dir = \"\",\n            .wal_path = wal_path,\n            .lock_path = lock_path,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .next_seq = 1,\n            .generation = 1,\n            .owns_wal_path = false,\n        };\n    }\n\n    pub fn deinit(self: *Self) void {\n        if (self.owns_wal_path) {\n            self.allocator.free(self.wal_path);\n        }\n        self.allocator.free(self.lock_path);\n        if (self.beads_dir.len > 0) {\n            self.allocator.free(self.beads_dir);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Get current generation number.\n    pub fn getGeneration(self: *Self) u64 {\n        return self.generation;\n    }\n\n    /// Refresh generation from disk and update WAL path if changed.\n    /// Call this before reading to ensure we're using the latest generation.\n    pub fn refreshGeneration(self: *Self) !bool {\n        if (self.beads_dir.len == 0) return false; // Not using generation-aware paths\n\n        var gen = Generation.init(self.beads_dir, self.allocator);\n        const current_gen = gen.read() catch return false;\n\n        if (current_gen != self.generation) {\n            // Generation changed - update WAL path\n            const new_wal_path = try gen.walPath(current_gen);\n\n            if (self.owns_wal_path) {\n                self.allocator.free(self.wal_path);\n            }\n            self.wal_path = new_wal_path;\n            self.owns_wal_path = true;\n            self.generation = current_gen;\n            return true;\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n\n    /// Rotate to a new generation (used by compactor).\n    /// Creates a new WAL file and returns the new generation number.\n    /// IMPORTANT: Caller must already hold the exclusive lock.\n    pub fn rotateGeneration(self: *Self) !u64 {\n        if (self.beads_dir.len == 0) return self.generation;\n\n        var gen = Generation.init(self.beads_dir, self.allocator);\n        // Use incrementUnlocked since caller (compact) already holds the lock\n        const new_gen = try gen.incrementUnlocked();\n\n        // Update our WAL path to the new generation\n        const new_wal_path = try gen.walPath(new_gen);\n\n        if (self.owns_wal_path) {\n            self.allocator.free(self.wal_path);\n        }\n        self.wal_path = new_wal_path;\n        self.owns_wal_path = true;\n        self.generation = new_gen;\n\n        // Clean up old generations (keep current and previous)\n        gen.cleanupOldGenerations(new_gen);\n\n        return new_gen;\n    }\n\n    /// Load the next sequence number from existing WAL entries.\n    /// Call this after init to ensure sequence numbers are unique.\n    pub fn loadNextSeq(self: *Self) !void {\n        const entries = self.readEntries() catch return;\n        defer {\n            for (entries) |*e| {\n                var entry = e.*;\n                entry.deinit(self.allocator);\n            }\n            self.allocator.free(entries);\n        }\n\n        var max_seq: u64 = 0;\n        for (entries) |e| {\n            if (e.seq > max_seq) max_seq = e.seq;\n        }\n        self.next_seq = max_seq + 1;\n    }\n\n    /// Append an entry to the WAL under exclusive lock.\n    /// Ensures durability via fsync before releasing lock.\n    /// Assigns a monotonic sequence number to the entry.\n    pub fn appendEntry(self: *Self, entry: WalEntry) !void {\n        var lock = BeadsLock.acquire(self.lock_path) catch return WalError.LockFailed;\n        defer lock.release();\n\n        // Assign sequence number under lock\n        var entry_with_seq = entry;\n        entry_with_seq.seq = self.next_seq;\n        self.next_seq += 1;\n\n        try self.appendEntryUnlocked(entry_with_seq);\n    }\n\n    /// Append entry without acquiring lock (caller must hold lock).\n    fn appendEntryUnlocked(self: *Self, entry: WalEntry) !void {\n        const dir = fs.cwd();\n\n        // Ensure parent directory exists\n        if (std.fs.path.dirname(self.wal_path)) |parent| {\n            dir.makePath(parent) catch |err| switch (err) {\n                error.PathAlreadyExists => {},\n                else => return err,\n            };\n        }\n\n        // Open or create WAL file in append mode\n        const file = dir.createFile(self.wal_path, .{\n            .truncate = false,\n        }) catch return WalError.WriteError;\n        defer file.close();\n\n        // Seek to end\n        file.seekFromEnd(0) catch return WalError.WriteError;\n\n        // Serialize entry to JSON\n        const json_bytes = std.json.Stringify.valueAlloc(self.allocator, entry, .{}) catch return WalError.WriteError;\n        defer self.allocator.free(json_bytes);\n\n        // Compute CRC32 checksum of the JSON payload\n        const crc = std.hash.Crc32.hash(json_bytes);\n\n        // Write binary frame header: [magic:u32][crc:u32][len:u32]\n        const len: u32 = @intCast(json_bytes.len);\n        var header: [FRAME_HEADER_SIZE]u8 = undefined;\n        std.mem.writeInt(u32, header[0..4], WAL_MAGIC, .little);\n        std.mem.writeInt(u32, header[4..8], crc, .little);\n        std.mem.writeInt(u32, header[8..12], len, .little);\n\n        file.writeAll(&header) catch return WalError.WriteError;\n        file.writeAll(json_bytes) catch return WalError.WriteError;\n        file.writeAll(\"\\n\") catch return WalError.WriteError;\n\n        // fsync for durability\n        file.sync() catch return WalError.WriteError;\n    }\n\n    /// Read all WAL entries with generation-aware consistency checking.\n    /// Supports both framed format (with CRC32) and legacy plain JSON lines.\n    /// If generation changes during read (compaction occurred), retries with new generation.\n    pub fn readEntries(self: *Self) ![]ParsedWalEntry {\n        // If using generation-aware paths, check for consistency\n        if (self.beads_dir.len > 0) {\n            return self.readEntriesWithGenerationCheck();\n        }\n        return self.readEntriesFromPath(self.wal_path);\n    }\n\n    /// Read entries with generation consistency checking.\n    /// Retries up to 3 times if generation changes during read.\n    fn readEntriesWithGenerationCheck(self: *Self) ![]ParsedWalEntry {\n        var gen = Generation.init(self.beads_dir, self.allocator);\n        const max_retries: u32 = 3;\n        var attempts: u32 = 0;\n\n        while (attempts < max_retries) : (attempts += 1) {\n            // Read generation before loading\n            const gen_before = gen.read() catch self.generation;\n\n            // Get WAL path for this generation\n            const wal_path = try gen.walPath(gen_before);\n            defer self.allocator.free(wal_path);\n\n            // Read entries\n            const entries = try self.readEntriesFromPath(wal_path);\n\n            // Read generation after loading\n            const gen_after = gen.read() catch gen_before;\n\n            if (gen_before == gen_after) {\n                // Generation stable - return consistent state\n                // Update our cached generation\n                if (gen_before != self.generation) {\n                    if (self.owns_wal_path) {\n                        self.allocator.free(self.wal_path);\n                    }\n                    self.wal_path = try gen.walPath(gen_before);\n                    self.owns_wal_path = true;\n                    self.generation = gen_before;\n                }\n                return entries;\n            }\n\n            // Generation changed during read - free entries and retry\n            for (entries) |*e| {\n                var entry = e.*;\n                entry.deinit(self.allocator);\n            }\n            self.allocator.free(entries);\n        }\n\n        // Max retries exceeded - return latest generation's entries\n        const final_gen = gen.read() catch self.generation;\n        const final_path = try gen.walPath(final_gen);\n        defer self.allocator.free(final_path);\n        return self.readEntriesFromPath(final_path);\n    }\n\n    /// Read entries from a specific WAL file path.\n    fn readEntriesFromPath(self: *Self, path: []const u8) ![]ParsedWalEntry {\n        const file = fs.cwd().openFile(path, .{}) catch |err| switch (err) {\n            error.FileNotFound => return &[_]ParsedWalEntry{},\n            else => return err,\n        };\n        defer file.close();\n\n        const content = file.readToEndAlloc(self.allocator, 100 * 1024 * 1024) catch return WalError.ParseError;\n        defer self.allocator.free(content);\n\n        var entries: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(ParsedWalEntry) = .{};\n        errdefer {\n            for (entries.items) |*e| {\n                e.deinit(self.allocator);\n            }\n            entries.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        var pos: usize = 0;\n        while (pos < content.len) {\n            // Try to parse as framed entry first (check for magic bytes)\n            if (pos + FRAME_HEADER_SIZE <= content.len) {\n                const magic = std.mem.readInt(u32, content[pos..][0..4], .little);\n                if (magic == WAL_MAGIC) {\n                    // Framed format: [magic:u32][crc:u32][len:u32][json][newline]\n                    const stored_crc = std.mem.readInt(u32, content[pos + 4 ..][0..4], .little);\n                    const len = std.mem.readInt(u32, content[pos + 8 ..][0..4], .little);\n\n                    const payload_start = pos + FRAME_HEADER_SIZE;\n                    const payload_end = payload_start + len;\n\n                    // Check for truncation\n                    if (payload_end > content.len) {\n                        // Truncated entry - skip to end (partial write from crash)\n                        break;\n                    }\n\n                    const json_payload = content[payload_start..payload_end];\n\n                    // Verify CRC32\n                    const computed_crc = std.hash.Crc32.hash(json_payload);\n                    if (computed_crc != stored_crc) {\n                        // CRC mismatch - corrupted entry, skip it\n                        // Try to find next entry by looking for next magic or newline\n                        pos = payload_end;\n                        if (pos < content.len and content[pos] == '\\n') {\n                            pos += 1;\n                        }\n                        continue;\n                    }\n\n                    // Parse the JSON payload\n                    if (self.parseEntry(json_payload)) |entry| {\n                        try entries.append(self.allocator, entry);\n                    } else |_| {\n                        // JSON parse error - skip\n                    }\n\n                 }\n                    continue;\n                }\n            }\n\n            // Fall back to legacy plain JSON line format\n            // Find the next newline\n            var line_end = pos;\n            while (line_end < content.len and content[line_end] != '\\n') {\n                line_end += 1;\n            }\n\n            if (line_end > pos) {\n                const line = content[pos..line_end];\n                if (self.parseEntry(line)) |entry| {\n                    try entries.append(self.allocator, entry);\n                } else |_| {\n                    // Skip malformed entries (graceful degradation)\n                }\n            }\n\n            pos = line_end;\n            if (pos < content.len and content[pos] == '\\n') {\n                pos += 1;\n            }\n        }\n\n        return entries.toOwnedSlice(self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    /// Parse a single WAL entry line.\n    fn parseEntry(self: *Self, line: []const u8) true, .allocate = .alloc_always },\n        ) catch return WalError.ParseError;\n        defer parsed.deinit();\n\n        const op = WalOp.fromString(parsed.value.op) orelse return WalError.InvalidOperation;\n\n        // Clone strings since parsed will be freed\n        const id = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, parsed.value.id);\n        errdefer self.allocator.free(id);\n\n operations in timestamp/sequence order.\n    /// Returns statistics about the replay including any failures.\n    pub fn replay(self: *Self, store: *IssueStore) !ReplayStats {\n        const entries = try self.readEntries();\n        defer {\n            for (entries) |*e| {\n                var entry = e.*;\n                entry.deinit(self.allocator);\n            }\n std.mem.sortUnstable(ParsedWalEntry, @constCast(entries), {}, struct {\n            fn lessThan(_: void, a: ParsedWalEntry, b: ParsedWalEntry) bool {\n                if (a.ts != b.ts) return a.ts < b.ts;\n                return a.seq < b.seq;\n            }\n        }.lessThan);\n\n        // Track replay results\n        var stats = ReplayStats{};\n        var failure_ids: const id_copy = self.allocator.dupe(u8, entry.id) catch continue;\n                    failure_ids.append(self.allocator, id_copy) catch {\n                        self.allocator.free(id_copy);\n                    };\n                },\n            }\n        }\n\n        stats.failure_ids = failure_ids.toOwnedSlice(self.allocator) catch &.{};\n        return stats;\n    }\n\n    /// Result of applying a single WAL entry.\n    const ApplyResult = enum {\n        applied,\n        skipped,\n        failed,\n    };\n\n    /// Apply a single WAL entry to the store.\n    /// Returns the result of the operation.\n    fn applyEntry(self: *Self, store: *IssueStore, entry: ParsedWalEntry) ApplyResult {\n        _ = self;\n        switch (entry.op) {\n            .add => {\n                if |err| switch (err) {\n                            error.DuplicateId => return .skipped, // Already exists\n                            else => return .failed,\n                        };\n operations\n//! - JSONL persistence via JsonlFile\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst JsonlFile = @import(\"jsonl.zig\").JsonlFile;\nconst Issue = @import(\"../models/issue.zig\").Issue;\nconst Rfc3339Timestamp = @import(\"../models/issue.zig\").Rfc3339Timestamp;\nconst OptionalRfc3339Timestamp = @import(\"../models/issue.zig\").OptionalRfc3339Timestamp;\nconst Status = @import(\"../models/status.zig\").Status;\nconst Priority = @import(\"../models/priority.zig\").Priority;\nconst IssueType = @import(\"../models/issue_type.zig\").IssueType;\nconst Dependency = @import(\"../models/dependency.zig\").Dependency;\nconst DependencyType = @import(\"../models/dependency.zig\").DependencyType;\nconst Comment = @import(\"../models/comment.zig\").Comment;\n\npub const IssueStoreError = error{\n    IssueNotFound,\n    DuplicateId,\n    InvalidIssue,\n};\n\n/// Result of loading the store with corruption tracking.\npub const StoreLoadResult = struct {\n    /// Number of corrupt JSONL entries skipped.\n    jsonl_corruption_count: usize = 0,\n    /// Line numbers of corrupt JSONL entries (1-indexed).\n    jsonl_corrupt_lines: []const usize = &.{},\n\n    pub fn hasCorruption(self: StoreLoadResult) bool {\n        return self.jsonl_corruption_count > 0;\n    }\n\n    pub fn deinit(self: *StoreLoadResult, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) void {\n        if (self.jsonl_corrupt_lines.len > 0) {\n            allocator.free(self.jsonl_corrupt_lines);\n        }\n    }\n};\n\npub const IssueStore = struct {\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    issues: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue),\n    id_index: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(usize),\n    dirty_ids: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(i64),\n    dirty: bool,\n    jsonl_path: []const u8,\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, jsonl_path: []const u8) Self {\n        return .{\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .issues = .{},\n            .id_index = .{},\n            .dirty_ids = .{},\n            .dirty = false,\n            .jsonl_path = jsonl_path,\n        };\n    }\n\n    pub fn deinit(self: *Self) void {\n        for (self.issues.items) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n        self.issues.deinit(self.allocator);\n\n        var id_it = self.id_index.keyIterator();\n        while (id_it.next()) |key| {\n            self.allocator.free(key.*);\n        }\n        self.id_index.deinit(self.allocator);\n\n        var dirty_it = self.dirty_ids.keyIterator();\n        while (dirty_it.next()) |key| {\n            self.allocator.free(key.*);\n        }\n        self.dirty_ids.deinit(self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    /// Load issues from the JSONL file into memory.\n    pub fn loadFromFile(self: *Self) !void {\n        var jsonl = JsonlFile.init(self.jsonl_path, self.allocator);\n        const loaded_issues = try jsonl.readAll();\n        defer self.allocator.free(loaded_issues);\n\n        for (loaded_issues) |issue| {\n            const id_copy = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, issue.id);\n            errdefer self.allocator.free(id_copy);\n\n            const idx = self.issues.items.len;\n            try self.issues.append(self.allocator, issue);\n            try self.id_index.put(self.allocator, id_copy, idx);\n        }\n\n        self.dirty = false;\n    }\n\n    /// Load issues from the JSONL file with graceful corruption recovery.\n    /// Logs and skips corrupt entries instead of failing.\n    /// Returns statistics about the load including corruption count.\n    pub fn loadFromFileWithRecovery(self: *Self) !StoreLoadResult {\n        var jsonl = JsonlFile.init(self.jsonl_path, self.allocator);\n        var load_result = try jsonl.readAllWithRecovery();\n        // Take ownership of corrupt_lines before freeing issues slice\n        const corrupt_lines = load_result.corrupt_lines;\n        load_result.corrupt_lines = &.{}; // Prevent double-free\n        errdefer if (corrupt_lines.len > 0) self.allocator.free(corrupt_lines);\n\n        const loaded_issues = load_result.issues;\n        defer self.allocator.free(loaded_issues);\n\n        for (loaded_issues) |issue| {\n            const id_copy = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, issue.id);\n            errdefer self.allocator.free(id_copy);\n\n            const idx = self.issues.items.len;\n            try self.issues.append(self.allocator, issue);\n            try self.id_index.put(self.allocator, id_copy, idx);\n        }\n\n        self.dirty = false;\n\n        return StoreLoadResult{\n            .jsonl_corruption_count = load_result.corruption_count,\n            .jsonl_corrupt_lines = corrupt_lines,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Save all issues to the JSONL file.\n    pub fn saveToFile(self: *Self) !void {\n        var jsonl = JsonlFile.init(self.jsonl_path, self.allocator);\n        try jsonl.writeAll(self.issues.items);\n        self.dirty = false;\n\n        // Clear dirty tracking\n        var dirty_it = self.dirty_ids.keyIterator();\n        while (dirty_it.next()) |key| {\n            self.allocator.free(key.*);\n        }\n        self.dirty_ids.clearRetainingCapacity();\n    }\n\n    /// Insert a new issue into the store.\n    pub fn insert(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        if (self.id_index.contains(issue.id)) {\n            return IssueStoreError.DuplicateId;\n        }\n\n        const cloned = try issue.clone(self.allocator);\n        errdefer {\n            var c = cloned;\n            c.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        const id_copy = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, cloned.id);\n        errdefer self.allocator.free(id_copy);\n\n        const idx = self.issues.items.len;\n        try self.issues.append(self.allocator, cloned);\n        try self.id_index.put(self.allocator, id_copy, idx);\n\n        try self.markDirty(issue.id);\n    }\n\n    /// Get an issue by ID (without embedded relations).\n    pub fn get(self: *Self, id: []const u8) !?Issue {\n        const idx = self.id_index.get(id) orelse return null;\n        if (idx >= self.issues.items.len) return null;\n\n        return try self.issues.items[idx].clone(self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    /// Get an issue with all embedded relations (labels, deps, comments).\n    /// Since we store everything in-memory, this just returns the issue as-is.\n    pub fn getWithRelations(self: *Self, id: []const u8) !?Issue {\n        return try self.get(id);\n    }\n\n    /// Get a reference to the stored issue (no clone).\n    /// Caller must NOT free or modify the returned issue.\n    pub fn getRef(self: *Self, id: []const u8) ?*Issue {\n        const idx = self.id_index.get(id) orelse return null;\n        if (idx >= self.issues.items.len) return null;\n        return &self.issues.items[idx];\n    }\n\n    /// Fields that can be updated on an issue.\n    pub const IssueUpdate = struct {\n        title: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        description: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        design: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        acceptance_criteria: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        notes: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        status: ?Status = null,\n        priority: ?Priority = null,\n        issue_type: ?IssueType = null,\n        assignee: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        owner: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        estimated_minutes: ?i32 = null,\n        closed_at: ?i64 = null,\n        close_reason: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        due_at: ?i64 = null,\n        defer_until: ?i64 = null,\n        external_ref: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        source_system: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        pinned: ?bool = null,\n        is_template: ?bool = null,\n        content_hash: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    };\n\n    /// Update an issue with the given fields.\n    pub fn update(self: *Self, id: []const u8, updates: IssueUpdate, now: i64) !void {\n        const idx = self.id_index.get(id) orelse return IssueStoreError.IssueNotFound;\n        if (idx >= self.issues.items.len) return IssueStoreError.IssueNotFound;\n\n        var issue = &self.issues.items[idx];\n\n        // Update timestamp\n        issue.updated_at = Rfc3339Timestamp{ .value = now };\n\n        // Apply updates\n        if (updates.title) |v| {\n            self.allocator.free(issue.title);\n            issue.title = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.description) |v| {\n            if (issue.description) |d| self.allocator.free(d);\n            issue.description = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.design) |v| {\n            if (issue.design) |d| self.allocator.free(d);\n            issue.design = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.acceptance_criteria) |v| {\n            if (issue.acceptance_criteria) |a| self.allocator.free(a);\n            issue.acceptance_criteria = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.notes) |v| {\n            if (issue.notes) |n| self.allocator.free(n);\n            issue.notes = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.status) |v| {\n            freeStatus(issue.status, self.allocator);\n            issue.status = try cloneStatus(v, self.allocator);\n        }\n        if (updates.priority) |v| {\n            issue.priority = v;\n        }\n        if (updates.issue_type) |v| {\n            freeIssueType(issue.issue_type, self.allocator);\n            issue.issue_type = try cloneIssueType(v, self.allocator);\n        }\n        if (updates.assignee) |v| {\n            if (issue.assignee) |a| self.allocator.free(a);\n            issue.assignee = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.owner) |v| {\n            if (issue.owner) |o| self.allocator.free(o);\n            issue.owner = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.estimated_minutes) |v| {\n            issue.estimated_minutes = v;\n        }\n        if (updates.closed_at) |v| {\n            issue.closed_at = OptionalRfc3339Timestamp{ .value = v };\n        }\n        if (updates.close_reason) |v| {\n            if (issue.close_reason) |r| self.allocator.free(r);\n            issue.close_reason = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.due_at) |v| {\n            issue.due_at = OptionalRfc3339Timestamp{ .value = v };\n        }\n        if (updates.defer_until) |v| {\n            issue.defer_until = OptionalRfc3339Timestamp{ .value = v };\n        }\n        if (updates.external_ref) |v| {\n            if (issue.external_ref) |e| self.allocator.free(e);\n            issue.external_ref = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.source_system) |v| {\n            if (issue.source_system) |s| self.allocator.free(s);\n            issue.source_system = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n        if (updates.pinned) |v| {\n            issue.pinned = v;\n        }\n        if (updates.is_template) |v| {\n            issue.is_template = v;\n        }\n        if (updates.content_hash) |v| {\n            if (issue.content_hash) |h| self.allocator.free(h);\n            issue.content_hash = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, v);\n        }\n\n        try self.markDirty(id);\n    }\n\n    /// Soft delete an issue by setting its status to tombstone.\n    pub fn delete(self: *Self, id: []const u8, now: i64) !void {\n        try self.update(id, .{ .status = .tombstone }, now);\n    }\n\n    /// Filters for listing issues.\n    pub const ListFilters = struct {\n        status: ?Status = null,\n        priority: ?Priority = null,\n        issue_type: ?IssueType = null,\n        assignee: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        label: ?[]const u8 = null,\n        include_tombstones: bool = false,\n        limit: ?u32 = null,\n        offset: ?u32 = null,\n        order_by: OrderBy = .created_at,\n        order_desc: bool = true,\n\n        pub const OrderBy = enum {\n            created_at,\n            updated_at,\n            priority,\n        };\n    };\n\n    /// List issues with optional filters.\n    pub fn list(self: *Self, filters: ListFilters) ![]Issue {\n        var results: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n        errdefer {\n            for (results.items) |*issue| {\n                issue.deinit(self.allocator);\n            }\n            results.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        for (self.issues.items) |issue| {\n            // Filter tombstones\n            if (!filters.include_tombstones and statusEql(issue.status, .tombstone)) {\n                continue;\n            }\n\n            // Apply filters\n            if (filters.status) |s| {\n                if (!statusEql(issue.status, s)) continue;\n            }\n            if (filters.priority) |p| {\n                if (issue.priority.value != p.value) continue;\n            }\n            if (filters.issue_type) |t| {\n                if (!issueTypeEql(issue.issue_type, t)) continue;\n            }\n            if (filters.assignee) |a| {\n                if (issue.assignee == null) continue;\n                if (!std.mem.eql(u8, issue.assignee.?, a)) continue;\n            }\n            if (filters.label) |lbl| {\n                var found = false;\n                for           if (!found) continue;\n            }\n\n            try results.append(self.allocator, try issue.clone(self.allocator));\n        }\n\n        // Sort\n        const SortContext = struct {\n            order_by: ListFilters.OrderBy,\n            order_desc: bool,\n        };\n        const ctx = SortContext{ .order_by = filters.order_by, .order_desc = filters.order_desc };\n\n        std.mem.sortUnstable(Issue, results.items, ctx, struct {\n            fn lessThan(c: SortContext, a: Issue, b: Issue) bool {\n                const cmp: i64 = switch (c.order_by) {\n @as(i64, b.priority.value),\n                };\n                return if (c.order_desc) cmp > 0 else cmp < 0;\n            }\n        }.lessThan);\n\n        // Apply offset and limit\n        var start: usize = 0;\n        if (filters.offset) |off| {\n            start = @min(off, results.items.len);\n        }\n\n        var end: usize = results.items.len;\n        if (filters.limit) |lim| {\n            end = @min(start + lim, results.items.len);\n        }\n\n        // Free items outside the range\n        for (results.items[0..start]) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n        for (results.items[end..]) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        // Return slice\n        const slice = try self.allocator.dupe(Issue, results.items[start..end]);\n        results.deinit(self.allocator);\n        return slice;\n    }\n\n    /// Result from counting issues.\n    pub const CountResult = struct {\n        key: []const u8,\n        count: u64,\n    };\n\n    /// Count issues, optionally grouped by a field.\n    pub fn count(self: *Self, group_by: ?GroupBy) ![]CountResult {\n        var counts: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(u64) = .{};\n        defer counts.deinit(self.allocator);\n\n        for (self.issues.items) |issue| {\n            if (statusEql(issue.status, .tombstone)) unreachable,\n                },\n                .issue_type => issue.issue_type.toString(),\n                .assignee => issue.assignee orelse \"(unassigned)\",\n            } else \"total\";\n\n            const entry = counts.getOrPutValue(self.allocator, key_str, 0) catch continue;\n            entry.value_ptr.* += 1;\n        }\n\n        var results: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(CountResult) = .{};\n        errdefer {\n            for (results.items) |r| {\n                self.allocator.free(r.key);\n            }\n            results.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        var it = counts.iterator();\n        while (it.next()) |entry| {\n            const key = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, entry.key_ptr.*);\n            try results.append(self.allocator, .{ .key = key, .count = assignee,\n    };\n\n    /// Check if an issue exists.\n    pub fn exists(self: *Self, id: []const u8) !bool {\n        return self.id_index.contains(id);\n    }\n\n    /// Get labels for an issue.\n    pub fn getLabels(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8) ![]const []const u8 {\n        const idx = self.id_index.get(issue_id) orelse return &[_][]const u8{};\n        if (idx >= self.issues.items.len) issue.labels.len);\n        errdefer self.allocator.free(labels);\n\n        for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n            labels[i] = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, label);\n        }\n        return labels;\n    }\n\n    /// Add a label to an issue.\n    pub fn addLabel(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8, label: []const u8) !void {\n        const idx = self.id_index.get(issue_id) orelse return IssueStoreError.IssueNotFound;\n        if (idx >= self.issues.items.len) return IssueStoreError.IssueNotFound;\n\n        var issue = &self.issues.items[idx];\n\n        // Check if already exists\n        for (issue.labels) |existing| {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, existing, label)) return;\n        }\n\n        // Add new label\n        const label_copy = try    }\n        issue.labels = new_labels;\n\n        try self.markDirty(issue_id);\n    }\n\n    /// Remove a label from an issue.\n    pub fn removeLabel(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8, label: []const u8) !void {\n        const idx = self.id_index.get(issue_id) orelse return IssueStoreError.IssueNotFound;\n        if (idx >= self.issues.items.len) return IssueStoreError.IssueNotFound;\n\n issue.labels.len - 1);\n                var j: usize = 0;\n                for (issue.labels, 0..) |lbl, i| {\n                    if (i != fi) {\n                        new_labels[j] = lbl;\n self.markDirty(issue_id);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Get dependencies for an issue.\n    pub fn getDependencies(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8) ![]const Dependency {\n        const idx = self.id_index.get(issue_id) orelse return &[_]Dependency{};\n        if (idx >= self.issues.items.len) return &[_]Dependency{};\n\n        const issue = self.issues.items[idx];\n        if (issue.dependencies.len == 0) return &[_]Dependency{};\n\n        const deps = try self.allocator.alloc(Dependency, issue.dependencies.len);\n        errdefer self.allocator.free(deps);\n\n        for return comments;\n    }\n\n    /// Add a comment to an issue.\n    pub fn addComment(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8, comment: Comment) !void {\n        const idx = self.id_index.get(issue_id) self.allocator.dupe(u8, id);\n            try self.dirty_ids.put(self.allocator, id_copy, now);\n        } else {\n            self.dirty_ids.getPtr(id).?.* = now;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Clear dirty flag for an issue.\n    pub fn clearDirty(self: *Self, id: []const u8) !void {\n        if (self.dirty_ids.fetchRemove(id)) |kv| {\n            self.allocator.free(kv.key);\n        }\n    }\n\n for similar ID lookup.\n    pub const IdSuggestion = struct {\n        id: []const u8,\n        title: []const u8,\n    };\n\n    /// Find similar IDs when a lookup fails (for \"did you mean\" candidate)) {\n        score += 80;\n    }\n\n    // Common prefix length\n    var common_prefix: usize = 0;\n    const min_len = @min(target.len, candidate.len);\n    for (0..min_len) |i| {\n Sync command for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz sync` - Bidirectional sync with JSONL file\n//! `bz sync --flush-only` - Export to JSONL only\n//! `bz sync --import-only` - Import from JSONL only\n//!\n//! Handles synchronization between in-memory state and JSONL file.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst IssueStore = common.IssueStore;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\n\npub const SyncError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    MergeConflictDetected,\n    ImportError,\n    ExportError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const SyncResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    action: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    issues_exported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_updated: ?usize = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    sync_args: args.SyncArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return SyncError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    if (sync_args.flush_only) {\n        try runFlush(&ctx, structured_output, global.quiet);\n    } else if (sync_args.import_only) {\n        try runImport(&ctx, structured_output, global.quiet, allocator);\n    } else {\n        try runBidirectional(&ctx, structured_output, global.quiet, allocator);\n    }\n}\n\nfn runFlush(ctx: *CommandContext, structured_output: bool, quiet: bool) !void {\n    const count = ctx.store.issues.items.len;\n\n    ctx.store.saveToFile() catch {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(SyncResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, \"failed to export issues\");\n        return SyncError.ExportError;\n    };\n\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try ctx.output.printJson(SyncResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .action = \"flush\",\n            .issues_exported = count,\n        });\n    } else if (!quiet) {\n        try ctx.output.success(\"Exported {d} issue(s) to JSONL\", .{count});\n    }\n}\n\nfn runImport(ctx: *CommandContext, structured_output: bool, quiet: bool, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !void {\n    // Check for merge conflict markers in the JSONL file\n    if (try hasMergeConflicts(ctx.store.jsonl_path, allocator)) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(SyncResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, \"JSONL file contains merge conflict markers - resolve conflicts first\");\n        return SyncError.MergeConflictDetected;\n    }\n\n    // Reload from file (this replaces in-memory state)\n    const old_count = ctx.store.issues.items.len;\n\n    // Deinit existing issues\n    for (ctx.store.issues.items) |*issue| {\n        issue.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n    ctx.store.issues.clearRetainingCapacity();\n\n    // Clear and rebuild index\n    var id_it = ctx.store.id_index.keyIterator();\n    while (id_it.next()) |key| {\n        allocator.free(key.*);\n    }\n    ctx.store.id_index.clearRetainingCapacity();\n\n    // Reload from file\n    ctx.store.loadFromFile() catch {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(SyncResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, \"failed to import from JSONL\");\n        return SyncError.ImportError;\n    };\n\n    const new_count = ctx.store.issues.items.len;\n\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try ctx.output.printJson(SyncResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .action = \"import\",\n            .issues_imported = new_count,\n        });\n    } else if (!quiet) {\n        if (new_count > old_count) {\n            try ctx.output.success(\"Imported {d} issue(s) from JSONL (+{d})\", .{ new_count, new_count - old_count });\n        } else if (new_count < old_count) {\n            try ctx.output.success(\"Imported {d} issue(s) from JSONL (-{d})\", .{ new_count, old_count - new_count });\n        } else {\n            try ctx.output.success(\"Imported {d} issue(s) from JSONL (no change)\", .{new_count});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn runBidirectional(ctx: *CommandContext, structured_output: bool, quiet: bool, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !void {\n    // Check for merge conflict markers\n    if (try hasMergeConflicts(ctx.store.jsonl_path, allocator)) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(SyncResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, \"JSONL file contains merge conflict markers - resolve conflicts first\");\n        return SyncError.MergeConflictDetected;\n    }\n\n    // For bidirectional sync, we export the current state\n    // A full bidirectional merge would require content hashing which is complex\n    const count = ctx.store.issues.items.len;\n\n    if (ctx.store.dirty) {\n        ctx.store.saveToFile() catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(SyncResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, \"failed to sync issues\");\n            return SyncError.ExportError;\n        };\n\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try ctx.output.printJson(SyncResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .action = \"sync\",\n                .issues_exported = count,\n            });\n        } else if (!quiet) {\n            try ctx.output.success(\"Synced {d} issue(s)\", .{count});\n        }\n    } else {\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try ctx.output.printJson(SyncResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .action = \"sync\",\n                .message = \"no changes to sync\",\n            });\n        } else if (!quiet) {\n            try ctx.output.info(\"No changes to sync\", .{});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\n/// Check if the JSONL file contains git merge conflict markers\nfn hasMergeConflicts(path: []const u8, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !bool {\n    const file = std.fs.cwd().openFile(path, .{}) catch |err| switch (err) {\n        error.FileNotFound => return false,\n        else => return err,\n    };\n    defer file.close();\n\n    const content = try file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 1024 * 1024 * 10);\n    defer allocator.free(content);\n\n    // Check for common merge conflict markers\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \"<<<<<<<\") != null) return true;\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \"=======\") != null) return true;\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \">>>>>>>\") != null) return true;\n\n    return false;\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"SyncError enum exists\" {\n    const err: SyncError = SyncError.MergeConflictDetected;\n    try std.testing.expect(err == SyncError.MergeConflictDetected);\n}\n\ntest \"SyncResult struct {"type":"assistant","message":{"model":"claude-opus-4-5-20251101","id":"msg_017kRJHw6ZdM2oL918DqJsx5","type":"message","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_016qgPWqhPW4QzXhGjZ1RLxc","name":"Write","input":{"file_path":"/home/hotschmoe/beads_zig/src/cli/batch.zig","content":"//! Batch operations for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! - `bz add-batch` - Create multiple issues from stdin/file with single lock\n//! - `bz import <file>` - Import issues from JSONL file with single lock\n//!\n//! These operations reduce lock contention for bulk operations by acquiring\n//! a single lock, performing all insertions, and releasing.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst id_gen = @import(\"../id/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Priority = models.Priority;\nconst IssueType = models.IssueType;\nconst IssueStore = storage.IssueStore;\nconst JsonlFile = storage.JsonlFile;\nconst IdGenerator = id_gen.IdGenerator;\n\npub const BatchError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    StorageError,\n    InvalidInput,\n    FileReadError,\n    NoIssuesToAdd,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const BatchResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues_created: ?usize = null,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_skipped: ?usize = null,\n    ids: ?[]const []const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub const ImportResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_skipped: ?usize = null,\n    issues_updated: ?usize = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Run the add-batch command.\n/// Creates multiple issues with a single lock acquisition and fsync.\npub fn runAddBatch(\n    batch_args: args.AddBatchArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return BatchError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return BatchError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Read input (from file or stdin)\n    const input_content = if (batch_args.file) |file_path|\n        readFileContent(file_path, allocator) catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read input file\");\n            return BatchError.FileReadError;\n        }\n    else\n        readStdinContent(allocator) catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read from stdin\");\n            return BatchError.FileReadError;\n        };\n    defer allocator.free(input_content);\n\n    // Parse input based on format\n    var issues_to_add: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (issues_to_add.items) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        issues_to_add.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    // Load existing issues to get count for ID generation\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    // Get config prefix\n    const prefix = try getConfigPrefix(allocator, beads_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(prefix);\n\n    // Get actor\n    const actor = global.actor orelse getDefaultActor();\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    var generator = IdGenerator.init(prefix);\n    var issue_count = store.countTotal();\n\n    // Parse input and create issues\n    switch (batch_args.format) {\n        .titles => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n                if (trimmed.len > 500) continue; // Skip titles that are too long\n\n                const issue_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                errdefer allocator.free(issue_id);\n                issue_count += 1;\n\n                var issue = Issue.init(issue_id, trimmed, now);\n                issue.created_by = actor;\n\n                // Clone strings for owned storage\n                const cloned = try issue.clone(allocator);\n                allocator.free(issue_id); // clone made its own copy\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, cloned);\n            }\n        },\n        .jsonl => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n\n                // Parse as Issue JSON\n                const parsed = std.json.parseFromSlice(\n                    Issue,\n                    allocator,\n                    trimmed,\n                    .{ .ignore_unknown_fields = true, .allocate = .alloc_always },\n                ) catch continue; // Skip malformed entries\n\n                // If no ID, generate one\n                var issue = parsed.value;\n                if (issue.id.len == 0) {\n                    const new_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                    allocator.free(issue.id);\n                    issue.id = new_id;\n                    issue_count += 1;\n                }\n\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, issue);\n            }\n        },\n    }\n\n    if (issues_to_add.items.len == 0) {\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(BatchResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .issues_created = 0,\n                .message = \"no issues to add\",\n            });\n        } else if (!global.quiet) {\n            try output.info(\"No issues to add\", .{});\n        }\n        return;\n    }\n\n    // Insert all issues (single save at end)\n    var created_ids: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (created_ids.items) |id| {\n            allocator.free(id);\n        }\n        created_ids.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    for (issues_to_add.items) |issue| {\n        store.insert(issue) catch |err| switch (err) {\n            error.DuplicateId => continue, // Skip duplicates\n            else => {\n                try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to insert issue\");\n                return BatchError.StorageError;\n            },\n        };\n        const id_copy = try allocator.dupe(u8, issue.id);\n        try created_ids.append(allocator, id_copy);\n    }\n\n    // Single atomic save\n    if (!global.no_auto_flush) {\n        store.saveToFile() catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to save issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        };\n    }\n\n    // Output result\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try output.printJson(BatchResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .issues_created = created_ids.items.len,\n            .ids = created_ids.items,\n        });\n    } else if (global.quiet) {\n        for (created_ids.items) |id| {\n            try output.raw(id);\n            try output.raw(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    } else {\n        try output.success(\"Created {d} issue(s)\", .{created_ids.items.len});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Run the import command.\n/// Imports issues from a JSONL file with single lock acquisition.\npub fn runImport(\n    import_args: args.ImportArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return BatchError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return BatchError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Check for merge conflict markers in import file\n    if (try hasMergeConflicts(import_args.file, allocator)) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"import file contains merge conflict markers\");\n        return BatchError.InvalidInput;\n    }\n\n    // Read and parse the import file\n    var import_jsonl = JsonlFile.init(import_args.file, allocator);\n    const imported_issues = import_jsonl.readAllWithRecovery() catch {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read import file\");\n        return BatchError.FileReadError;\n    };\n    defer {\n        for (imported_issues.issues) |*issue| {\n            var i = issue.*;\n            i.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(imported_issues.issues);\n        if (imported_issues.corrupt_lines.len > 0) {\n            allocator.free(imported_issues.corrupt_lines);\n        }\n    }\n\n    if (import_args.dry_run) {\n        // Dry run - just report what would be imported\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(ImportResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .issues_imported = imported_issues.issues.len,\n                .issues_skipped = imported_issues.corruption_count,\n                .message = \"dry run - no changes made\",\n            });\n        } else if (!global.quiet) {\n            try output.info(\"Would import {d} issue(s), skip {d} corrupt entries\", .{\n                imported_issues.issues.len,\n                imported_issues.corruption_count,\n            });\n        }\n        return;\n    }\n\n    // Load existing issues\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load existing issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    var imported_count: usize = 0;\n    var skipped_count: usize = 0;\n    var updated_count: usize = 0;\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n\n    for (imported_issues.issues) |issue| {\n        if (import_args.merge) {\n            // Merge mode: update if exists, insert if not\n            if (try store.exists(issue.id)) {\n                // Update existing issue\n                store.update(issue.id, .{\n                    .title = issue.title,\n                    .description = issue.description,\n                    .status = issue.status,\n                    .priority = issue.priority,\n                    .issue_type = issue.issue_type,\n                    .assignee = issue.assignee,\n                }, now) catch {\n                    skipped_count += 1;\n                    continue;\n                };\n                updated_count += 1;\n            } else {\n                store.insert(issue) catch {\n                    skipped_count += 1;\n                    continue;\n
