Batch operations for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! - `bz add-batch` - Create multiple issues from stdin/file with single lock\n//! - `bz import <file>` - Import issues from JSONL file with single lock\n//!\n//! These operations reduce lock contention for bulk operations by acquiring\n//! a single lock, performing all insertions, and releasing.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst id_gen = @import(\"../id/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Priority = models.Priority;\nconst IssueType = models.IssueType;\nconst IssueStore = storage.IssueStore;\nconst JsonlFile = storage.JsonlFile;\nconst IdGenerator = id_gen.IdGenerator;\n\npub const BatchError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    StorageError,\n    InvalidInput,\n    FileReadError,\n    NoIssuesToAdd,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const BatchResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues_created: ?usize = null,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_skipped: ?usize = null,\n    ids: ?[]const []const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub const ImportResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_skipped: ?usize = null,\n    issues_updated: ?usize = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Run the add-batch command.\n/// Creates multiple issues with a single lock acquisition and fsync.\npub fn runAddBatch(\n    batch_args: args.AddBatchArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return BatchError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return BatchError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Read input (from file or stdin)\n    const input_content = if (batch_args.file) |file_path|\n        readFileContent(file_path, allocator) catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read input file\");\n            return BatchError.FileReadError;\n        }\n    else\n        readStdinContent(allocator) catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read from stdin\");\n            return BatchError.FileReadError;\n        };\n    defer allocator.free(input_content);\n\n    // Parse input based on format\n    var issues_to_add: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (issues_to_add.items) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        issues_to_add.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    // Load existing issues to get count for ID generation\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    // Get config prefix\n    const prefix = try getConfigPrefix(allocator, beads_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(prefix);\n\n    // Get actor\n    const actor = global.actor orelse getDefaultActor();\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    var generator = IdGenerator.init(prefix);\n    var issue_count = store.countTotal();\n\n    // Parse input and create issues\n    switch (batch_args.format) {\n        .titles => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n                if (trimmed.len > 500) continue; // Skip titles that are too long\n\n                const issue_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                errdefer allocator.free(issue_id);\n                issue_count += 1;\n\n                var issue = Issue.init(issue_id, trimmed, now);\n                issue.created_by = actor;\n\n                // Clone strings for owned storage\n                const cloned = try issue.clone(allocator);\n                allocator.free(issue_id); // clone made its own copy\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, cloned);\n            }\n        },\n        .jsonl => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n\n                // Parse as Issue JSON\n                const parsed = std.json.parseFromSlice(\n                    Issue,\n                    allocator,\n                    trimmed,\n                    .{ .ignore_unknown_fields = true, .allocate = .alloc_always },\n                ) catch continue; // Skip malformed entries\n\n                // If no ID, generate one\n                var issue = parsed.value;\n                if (issue.id.len == 0) {\n                    const new_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                    allocator.free(issue.id);\n                    issue.id = new_id;\n                    issue_count += 1;\n                }\n\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, issue);\n            }\n        },\n    }\n\n    if (issues_to_add.items.len == 0) {\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(BatchResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .issues_created = 0,\n                .message = \"no issues to add\",\n            });\n        } else if (!global.quiet) {\n            try output.info(\"No issues to add\", .{});\n        }\n        return;\n    }\n\n    // Insert all issues (single save at end)\n    var created_ids: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (created_ids.items) |id| {\n            allocator.free(id);\n        }\n        created_ids.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    for (issues_to_add.items) |issue| {\n        store.insert(issue) catch |err| switch (err) {\n            error.DuplicateId => continue, // Skip duplicates\n            else => {\n                try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to insert issue\");\n                return BatchError.StorageError;\n            },\n        };\n        const id_copy = try allocator.dupe(u8, issue.id);\n        try created_ids.append(allocator, id_copy);\n    }\n\n    // Single atomic save\n    if (!global.no_auto_flush) {\n        store.saveToFile() catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to save issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        };\n    }\n\n    // Output result\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try output.printJson(BatchResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .issues_created = created_ids.items.len,\n            .ids = created_ids.items,\n        });\n    } else if (global.quiet) {\n        for (created_ids.items) |id| {\n            try output.raw(id);\n            try output.raw(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    } else {\n        try output.success(\"Created {d} issue(s)\", .{created_ids.items.len});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Run the import command.\n/// Imports issues from a JSONL file with single lock acquisition.\npub fn runImport(\n    import_args: args.ImportArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return BatchError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return BatchError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Check for merge conflict markers in import file\n    if (try hasMergeConflicts(import_args.file, allocator)) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"import file contains merge conflict markers\");\n        return BatchError.InvalidInput;\n    }\n\n    // Read and parse the import file\n    var import_jsonl = JsonlFile.init(import_args.file, allocator);\n    const imported_issues = import_jsonl.readAllWithRecovery() catch {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read import file\");\n        return BatchError.FileReadError;\n    };\n    defer {\n        for (imported_issues.issues) |*issue| {\n            var i = issue.*;\n            i.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(imported_issues.issues);\n        if (imported_issues.corrupt_lines.len > 0) {\n            allocator.free(imported_issues.corrupt_lines);\n        }\n    }\n\n    if (import_args.dry_run) {\n        // Dry run - just report what would be imported\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(ImportResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .issues_imported = imported_issues.issues.len,\n                .issues_skipped = imported_issues.corruption_count,\n                .message = \"dry run - no changes made\",\n            });\n        } else if (!global.quiet) {\n            try output.info(\"Would import {d} issue(s), skip {d} corrupt entries\", .{\n                imported_issues.issues.len,\n                imported_issues.corruption_count,\n            });\n        }\n        return;\n    }\n\n    // Load existing issues\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load existing issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    var imported_count: usize = 0;\n    var skipped_count: usize = 0;\n    var updated_count: usize = 0;\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n\n    for (imported_issues.issues) |issue| {\n        if (import_args.merge) {\n            // Merge mode: update if exists, insert if not\n            if (try store.exists(issue.id)) {\n                // Update existing issue\n                store.update(issue.id, .{\n                    .title = issue.title,\n                    .description = issue.description,\n                    .status = issue.status,\n                    .priority = issue.priority,\n                    .issue_type = issue.issue_type,\n                    .assignee = issue.assignee,\n                }, now) catch {\n                    skipped_count += 1;\n                    continue;\n                };\n                updated_count += 1;\n            } else {\n                store.insert(issue) catch {\n                    skipped_count += 1;\n                    continue;\n                };\n                imported_count += 1;\n            }\n        } else {\n            // Replace mode: skip if exists\n            if (try store.exists(issue.id)) {\n                skipped_count += 1;\n                continue;\n            }\n            store.insert(issue) catch {\n                skipped_count += 1;\n                continue;\n            };\n            imported_count += 1;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Single atomic save\n    if (!global.no_auto_flush) {\n        store.saveToFile() catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to save issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        };\n    }\n\n    // Output result\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try output.printJson(ImportResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .issues_imported = imported_count,\n            .issues_updated = if (import_args.merge) updated_count else null,\n            .issues_skipped = skipped_count + imported_issues.corruption_count,\n        });\n    } else if (!global.quiet) {\n        if (import_args.merge and updated_count > 0) {\n            try output.success(\"Imported {d}, updated {d}, skipped {d} issue(s)\", .{\n                imported_count,\n                updated_count,\n                skipped_count,\n            });\n        } else Batch operations for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! - `bz add-batch` - Create multiple issues from stdin/file with single lock\n//! - `bz import <file>` - Import issues from JSONL file with single lock\n//!\n//! These operations reduce lock contention for bulk operations by acquiring\n//! a single lock, performing all insertions, and releasing.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst id_gen = @import(\"../id/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Priority = models.Priority;\nconst IssueType = models.IssueType;\nconst IssueStore = storage.IssueStore;\nconst JsonlFile = storage.JsonlFile;\nconst IdGenerator = id_gen.IdGenerator;\n\npub const BatchError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    StorageError,\n    InvalidInput,\n    FileReadError,\n    NoIssuesToAdd,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const BatchResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues_created: ?usize = null,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_skipped: ?usize = null,\n    ids: ?[]const []const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub const ImportResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    issues_imported: ?usize = null,\n    issues_skipped: ?usize = null,\n    issues_updated: ?usize = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\n/// Run the add-batch command.\n/// Creates multiple issues with a single lock acquisition and fsync.\npub fn runAddBatch(\n    batch_args: args.AddBatchArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return BatchError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return BatchError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Read input from file\n    const file_path = batch_args.file orelse {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"file path required. Use 'bz add-batch <file>' or 'bz add-batch --file <file>'\");\n        return BatchError.InvalidInput;\n    };\n\n    const input_content = readFileContent(file_path, allocator) catch {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read input file\");\n        return BatchError.FileReadError;\n    };\n    defer allocator.free(input_content);\n\n    // Parse input based on format\n    var issues_to_add: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (issues_to_add.items) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        issues_to_add.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    // Load existing issues to get count for ID generation\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    // Get config prefix\n    const prefix = try getConfigPrefix(allocator, beads_dir);\n    defer allocator.free(prefix);\n\n    // Get actor\n    const actor = global.actor orelse getDefaultActor();\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    var generator = IdGenerator.init(prefix);\n    var issue_count = store.countTotal();\n\n    // Parse input and create issues\n    switch (batch_args.format) {\n        .titles => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n                if (trimmed.len > 500) continue; // Skip titles that are too long\n\n                const issue_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                errdefer allocator.free(issue_id);\n                issue_count += 1;\n\n                var issue = Issue.init(issue_id, trimmed, now);\n                issue.created_by = actor;\n\n                // Clone strings for owned storage\n                const cloned = try issue.clone(allocator);\n                allocator.free(issue_id); // clone made its own copy\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, cloned);\n            }\n        },\n        .jsonl => {\n            var line_iter = std.mem.splitScalar(u8, input_content, '\\n');\n            while (line_iter.next()) |line| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, line, \" \\t\\r\");\n                if (trimmed.len == 0) continue;\n\n                // Parse as Issue JSON\n                const parsed = std.json.parseFromSlice(\n                    Issue,\n                    allocator,\n                    trimmed,\n                    .{ .ignore_unknown_fields = true, .allocate = .alloc_always },\n                ) catch continue; // Skip malformed entries\n\n                // If no ID, generate one\n                var issue = parsed.value;\n                if (issue.id.len == 0) {\n                    const new_id = try generator.generate(allocator, issue_count);\n                    allocator.free(issue.id);\n                    issue.id = new_id;\n                    issue_count += 1;\n                }\n\n                try issues_to_add.append(allocator, issue);\n            }\n        },\n    }\n\n    if (issues_to_add.items.len == 0) {\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(BatchResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .issues_created = 0,\n                .message = \"no issues to add\",\n            });\n        } else if (!global.quiet) {\n            try output.info(\"No issues to add\", .{});\n        }\n        return;\n    }\n\n    // Insert all issues (single save at end)\n    var created_ids: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n    defer {\n        for (created_ids.items) |id| {\n            allocator.free(id);\n        }\n        created_ids.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    for (issues_to_add.items) |issue| {\n        store.insert(issue) catch |err| switch (err) {\n            error.DuplicateId => continue, // Skip duplicates\n            else => {\n                try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to insert issue\");\n                return BatchError.StorageError;\n            },\n        };\n        const id_copy = try allocator.dupe(u8, issue.id);\n        try created_ids.append(allocator, id_copy);\n    }\n\n    // Single atomic save\n    if (!global.no_auto_flush) {\n        store.saveToFile() catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(BatchResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to save issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        };\n    }\n\n    // Output result\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try output.printJson(BatchResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .issues_created = created_ids.items.len,\n            .ids = created_ids.items,\n        });\n    } else if (global.quiet) {\n        for (created_ids.items) |id| {\n            try output.raw(id);\n            try output.raw(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    } else {\n        try output.success(\"Created {d} issue(s)\", .{created_ids.items.len});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Run the import command.\n/// Imports issues from a JSONL file with single lock acquisition.\npub fn runImport(\n    import_args: args.ImportArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var output = common.initOutput(allocator, global);\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n\n    // Determine workspace path\n    const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n    const issues_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" });\n    defer allocator.free(issues_path);\n\n    // Check if workspace is initialized\n    std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n        if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\");\n            return BatchError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n        }\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"cannot access workspace\");\n        return BatchError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    // Check for merge conflict markers in import file\n    if (try hasMergeConflicts(import_args.file, allocator)) {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"import file contains merge conflict markers\");\n        return BatchError.InvalidInput;\n    }\n\n    // Read and parse the import file\n    var import_jsonl = JsonlFile.init(import_args.file, allocator);\n    const imported_issues = import_jsonl.readAllWithRecovery() catch {\n        try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to read import file\");\n        return BatchError.FileReadError;\n    };\n    defer {\n        for (imported_issues.issues) |*issue| {\n            var i = issue.*;\n            i.deinit(allocator);\n        }\n        allocator.free(imported_issues.issues);\n        if (imported_issues.corrupt_lines.len > 0) {\n            allocator.free(imported_issues.corrupt_lines);\n        }\n    }\n\n    if (import_args.dry_run) {\n        // Dry run - just report what would be imported\n        if (structured_output) {\n            try output.printJson(ImportResult{\n                .success = true,\n                .issues_imported = imported_issues.issues.len,\n                .issues_skipped = imported_issues.corruption_count,\n                .message = \"dry run - no changes made\",\n            });\n        } else if (!global.quiet) {\n            try output.info(\"Would import {d} issue(s), skip {d} corrupt entries\", .{\n                imported_issues.issues.len,\n                imported_issues.corruption_count,\n            });\n        }\n        return;\n    }\n\n    // Load existing issues\n    var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n    defer store.deinit();\n\n    store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n        if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to load existing issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        }\n    };\n\n    var imported_count: usize = 0;\n    var skipped_count: usize = 0;\n    var updated_count: usize = 0;\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n\n    for (imported_issues.issues) |issue| {\n        if (import_args.merge) {\n            // Merge mode: update if exists, insert if not\n            if (try store.exists(issue.id)) {\n                // Update existing issue\n                store.update(issue.id, .{\n                    .title = issue.title,\n                    .description = issue.description,\n                    .status = issue.status,\n                    .priority = issue.priority,\n                    .issue_type = issue.issue_type,\n                    .assignee = issue.assignee,\n                }, now) catch {\n                    skipped_count += 1;\n                    continue;\n                };\n                updated_count += 1;\n            } else {\n                store.insert(issue) catch {\n                    skipped_count += 1;\n                    continue;\n                };\n                imported_count += 1;\n            }\n        } else {\n            // Replace mode: skip if exists\n            if (try store.exists(issue.id)) {\n                skipped_count += 1;\n                continue;\n            }\n            store.insert(issue) catch {\n                skipped_count += 1;\n                continue;\n            };\n            imported_count += 1;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Single atomic save\n    if (!global.no_auto_flush) {\n        store.saveToFile() catch {\n            try common.outputErrorTyped(ImportResult, &output, structured_output, \"failed to save issues\");\n            return BatchError.StorageError;\n        };\n    }\n\n    // Output result\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try output.printJson(ImportResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .issues_imported = imported_count,\n            .issues_updated = if (import_args.merge) updated_count else null,\n            .issues_skipped = skipped_count + imported_issues.corruption_count,\n        });\n    } else if (!global.quiet) {\n        if (import_args.merge and updated_count > 0) {\n            try output.success(\"Imported {d}, updated {d}, skipped {d} issue(s)\", .{\n                imported_count,\n                updated_count,\n                skipped_count,\n            });\n        } else {\n            try output.success(\"Imported {d}, skipped {d} issue(s)\", .{ imported_count, skipped_count });\n        }\n    }\n}\n\n/// Read file content into a buffer.\nfn readFileContent(path: []const u8, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n    const file = try std.fs.cwd().openFile(path, .{});\n    defer file.close();\n    return try file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 100 * 1024 * 1024); // 100MB max\n}\n\n/// Read stdin content into a buffer.\nfn readStdinContent(allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n    const stdin = std.fs.File.stdin();\n    return try {\n    const file = std.fs.cwd().openFile(path, .{}) catch |err| switch (err) {\n        error.FileNotFound => return false,\n        else => return err,\n    };\n    defer file.close();\n\n    const content = try file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 1024 * 1024 * 10);\n    defer allocator.free(content);\n\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \"<<<<<<<\") != null) return true;\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \"=======\") != null) return true;\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \">>>>>>>\") != null) return true;\n\n    return false;\n}\n\n/// Get the default actor name from environment.\nfn getDefaultActor() ?[]const u8 {\n    const builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\n    if (builtin.os.tag == .windows) return null;\n    return std.posix.getenv(\"USER\") orelse std.posix.getenv(\"USERNAME\");\n}\n\n/// Read the ID prefix from config.yaml, defaulting to \"bd\".\nfn getConfigPrefix(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, beads_dir: []const u8) ![]u8 {\n    const config_path = try std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"config.yaml\" });\n    defer allocator.free(config_path);\n\n    const file = std.fs.cwd().openFile(config_path, .{}) catch {\n        return try allocator.dupe(u8, \"bd\");\n    };\n    defer file.close();\n\n    const content = file.readToEndAlloc(allocator, 4096) catch {\n        return try allocator.dupe(u8, \"bd\");\n    };\n    defer allocator.free(content);\n\n    if (std.mem.indexOf(u8, content, \"prefix:\")) |prefix_pos| {\n        const after_prefix = content[prefix_pos + 7 ..];\n        var i: usize = 0;\n        while              i += 1;\n                const start = i;\n                while (i < after_prefix.len and after_prefix[i] != '\"' and after_prefix[i] != '\\n') {\n                    i += 1;\n         while (i < after_prefix.len and after_prefix[i] != '\\n' and after_prefix[i] != ' ' and after_prefix[i] != '\\t') {\n                    i += 1;\n                }\n                if (i > {"type":"assistant","message":{"model":"claude-opus-4-5-20251101","id":"msg_018VsAN4RZQcJWNZF6fRJL3S","type":"message","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_019pxDVkjd8VqBwF8jxuksyn","name":"Bash","input":{"command":"git add src/cli/batch.zig src/cli/args.zig src/cli/mod.zig src/main.zig && git commit -m \"$(cat <<'EOF'\nfeat: add batch operations (add-batch, import)\n\nImplements batch operations for bulk issue management:\n\n- `bz add-batch <file>`: Create multiple issues from a file\n  - Supports --format titles (one title per line, default)\n  - Supports --format jsonl (full JSONL issue format)\n  - Single lock acquisition and fsync for all inserts\n\n- `bz import <file>`: Import issues from JSONL file\n  - Default: skip existing issues\n  - --merge: update existing, insert new\n  - --dry-run: preview without changes\n\nBenefits for concurrent agent usage:\n- Reduces lock contention for bulk operations\n- Single lock acquisition vs one per issue\n- Single fsync at end vs per-issue\n\nCo-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>\nEOF\n)\"","description":"Commit the batch operations implementation"}}],"stop_reason":null,"stop_sequence":null,"usage":{"input_tokens":0,"cache_creation_input_tokens":161,"cache_read_input_tokens":146523,"cache_creation":{"ephemeral_5m_input_tokens":0,"ephemeral_1h_input_tokens":161},"output_tokens":25,"service_tier":"standard"},"context_management":null},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"f9f63ef3-6343-4646-9a22-05414f232792","uuid":"be1c715c-e6ad-49ca-ba32-2f213ba2eeaa"}

{"type":"assistant","message":{"model":"claude-opus-4-5-20251101","id":"msg_01PEcpQ8oF675pWhPsEPCisb","type":"message","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The task is complete. Let me provide a summary.\n\n## Summary\n\nSuccessfully implemented batch operations for beads_zig:\n\n### New Commands\n\n1. **`bz add-batch <file>`** - Create multiple issues from a file with single lock acquisition\n   - `--format titles` (default): One issue title per line\n   - `--format jsonl`: Full JSONL issue format\n   - Aliases: `batch-add`, `batch`\n\n2. **`bz import <file>`** - Import issues from JSONL file\n   - Default: Skip existing issues (by ID)\n   - `--merge`: Update existing issues, insert new ones\n   - `--dry-run`: Preview what would be imported without making changes\n\n### Files Modified/Created\n\n- **`src/cli/args.zig`**: Added `AddBatchArgs`, `BatchFormat`, `ImportArgs` types and parsing\n- **`src/cli/batch.zig`**: New file with command implementations (created)\n- **`src/cli/mod.zig`**: Registered batch module and exports\n- **`src/main.zig`**: Added dispatch handlers and help text\n\n### Key Design Points\n\n- **Single lock acquisition**: Both commands load the store once, perform all insertions, then save once\n- **Reduces lock contention**: Critical for multiple agents importing issues concurrently\n- **JSON output**: Both commands support `--json` flag for machine-readable output\n- **Merge conflict detection**: Rejects files with git merge markers\n- **Graceful error handling**: Skips malformed entries instead of failing\n\n### Test Results\n\n- All 559 tests passed\n- Manual testing confirmed both commands work correctly"}],"stop_reason":null,"stop_sequence":null,"usage":{"input_tokens":0,"cache_creation_input_tokens":269,"cache_read_input_tokens":147069,"cache_creation":{"ephemeral_5m_input_tokens":0,"ephemeral_1h_input_tokens":269},"output_tokens":1,"service_tier":"standard"},"context_management":null},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"f9f63ef3-6343-4646-9a22-05414f232792","uuid":"a42b687b-c1d6-48fd-9859-8f05d13fa790"}
